answers.answer: Do you have any results, other than TSH?  TSH is a pituitary hormone, not a thyroid hormone.If you've had other tests, please post the results and reference ranges, since ranges vary lab to lab.If you haven't had any other tests done, you need to find a new doctor.  You need to be tested for Free T3, Free T4 and thyroid antibodies..  Those tests would include Thyroid Peroxidase Antibodies (TPOab) and Thryoglobulin Antibodies (TGab), to test for Hashimoto's Thyroiditis.  While Hashimoto's is usually associated with hypothyroidism, early phases can be characterized by periods of hyper.  The other antibody test you need is Thyroid Stimulating Immunoglobulin (TSI) to test for Graves Disease.Tiredness can be caused by both, hypo and hyper thyroidism, along with many other things like vitamin B12 or vitamin D deficiency, diabetes and other problems.Check out B-12 deficiency..
Thanks Barb I will ask Dr to help but may have to pay private. Do you live in England ? You sound like you have a good Dr !Lorraine x

No, I don't live in England.  I'd missed the fact that you are from U.K.  Unfortunately, we have a lot of members from there, who have to go private, due to the NHS guidelines.  Others have been able to "demand" what they want and have been successful, but that seems rather rare.  It seems that you might have to go private in order to get what you need.My doctor is "okay" but not the best... he tests what I need and lets me drive my treatment.

question: Hi AllI am new to this forum I've just had bloods done and my TSH is 0.76 they are within the range. But I am 46 and feel like an old woman have no energy and lately I have to go back to bed most mornings.Please could someone explain the results and tell me were I should go from here. I'd like to beable to work but I don't feel fit enough !!ThanksLorraine
title: Thyroid Results Tired in the Morning
